Inventory Tests Package

The inventory.tests package contains all testing and profiling modules for the inventory system, ensuring reliability and performance of inventory operations.

Submodules

inventory.tests.profile_inventory module

The profile_inventory module contains profiling tests to measure the performance of inventory-related operations.

inventory.tests.profile_inventory.profile_all_tests()[source]

Profiles all test functions in the test suite using cProfile.

inventory.tests.profiler_memory module

The profiler_memory module evaluates memory usage during inventory operations, ensuring optimal resource management.

inventory.tests.profiler_memory.run_memory_profiling()[source]

Runs pytest while profiling memory usage for the tests.

inventory.tests.test_app module

The test_app module includes unit tests to validate the functionality of inventory-related features such as adding, updating, and deleting inventory items.

inventory.tests.test_app.add_default_admin(db_session)[source]

Adds a default admin user to the database.

inventory.tests.test_app.add_inventory_item(db_session)[source]

Adds an inventory item to the database.

inventory.tests.test_app.add_product_manager(db_session)[source]

Adds a product manager user to the database.

inventory.tests.test_app.add_regular_user(db_session)[source]

Adds a regular customer user to the database.

inventory.tests.test_app.app()[source]

Creates a Flask application configured for testing.

inventory.tests.test_app.client(app)[source]

Provides a test client for the Flask application.

inventory.tests.test_app.db_session()[source]

Creates a new database session for a test.

inventory.tests.test_app.get_auth_tokens(client)[source]

Logs in all users to obtain JWT tokens. Returns a dictionary with ‘admin’, ‘user’, and manager tokens.

inventory.tests.test_app.test_add_item(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]
inventory.tests.test_app.test_add_item_bad_role(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]
inventory.tests.test_app.test_add_item_invalid_data(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]
inventory.tests.test_app.test_add_stock(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]
inventory.tests.test_app.test_add_stock_bad_amount(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]
inventory.tests.test_app.test_delete_item(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]
inventory.tests.test_app.test_delete_item_bad_role(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens, add_inventory_item)[source]
inventory.tests.test_app.test_delete_item_no_item(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]
inventory.tests.test_app.test_remove_stock(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]
inventory.tests.test_app.test_remove_stock_bad_quantity(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]
inventory.tests.test_app.test_remove_stock_insufficient(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]
inventory.tests.test_app.test_update_item(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]
inventory.tests.test_app.test_update_item_invalid_data(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]
inventory.tests.test_app.test_update_item_no_item(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]

Module Contents

The inventory.tests package consolidates all testing and profiling tools for the inventory system, supporting both functional and performance testing.
